model.implementations.components.manifests

Class AssetManifest

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.implementations.components.manifests.BasicManifest
      • model.implementations.components.manifests.SignedManifest
        • model.implementations.components.manifests.AssetManifest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Manifest

    public class AssetManifest
extends SignedManifest
    An Asset is identified by an asset GUID (incarnation). Unlike other GUIDs, the asset's GUID is not derived from contents. Instead an asset GUID is good for all time irrespective of the asset's contents. Assets do not contain data, thus they exist only in the manifest space. Assets refer to unions (atoms or compounds) - and they are used to assert commonality over a history of changes of unions.
    TODO - an asset also refers to metadata This class defines the manifest describing an Asset, which takes the following form:

    Manifest's GUID - GUID
    Asset's GUID (incarnation) - GUID
    ManifestType - ASSET
    Signature - ?
    Previous Asset - GUID
    Content (union) - GUID
    Metadata - GUID

    Author:
    Simone I. Conte "sic2@st-andrews.ac.uk"
    See Also:
    GUID
